citation.article-title: Halovivax asiaticus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel extremely halophilic archaeon isolated from Inner Mongolia, China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Halovivax asiaticus sp. nov.
Halovivax asiaticus (a.si.a′ti.cus. L. masc. adj. asiaticus pertaining to Asia, where the type strain was isolated).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Colonies are circular and 1–2 mm in diameter after incubation for 10 days at 37 °C.
Extremely halophilic and the cells lyse in water.
MgCl2 is not required.
Growth does not occur above 50 °C.
Amino acids are not required for growth.
Catalase-positive and weakly positive for oxidase.
Production of indole and methyl red, Voges–Proskauer and Simmons citrate tests are negative.
H2S is produced from cysteine.
Acid is produced from xylose.
Does not produce arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase or ornithine decarboxylase.
Produces urease.
Anaerobic growth with nitrate or l-arginine does not occur.
Starch, aesculin, phosphatase and DNase are not hydrolysed.
Gelatin, Tween 80 and casein are hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The following substrates are utilized for growth: lactose, raffinose, xylose, propionate, glutamate, trehalose and acetate.
No growth occurs on mannitol, d-arabinose, d-galactose, maltose, sucrose, glycerol, sorbitol, fructose, d-glucose, ribose, starch, succinate, malate or fumarate.
Sensitive to bacitracin and novobiocin.
Resistant to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, erythromycin, gentamicin, nalidixic acid, neomycin, penicillin G, rifampicin, streptomycin and tetracycline.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type and only strain is 60·3 mol%.
The type strain, EJ-46T (=CGMCC 1.4248T=CECT 7098T), was isolated from the saline Lake Ejinor in Inner Mongolia, China.
